course_description: Learn Python fundamentals for beginners, including syntax, data structures, and problem-solving techniques to build your first programs.
course_overview: This beginner-friendly course covers core Python programming concepts such as variables, control structures, functions, and file handling. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop practical coding skills and understand how to approach basic programming challenges systematically. The course emphasizes writing clean, readable code and introduces essential tools for Python development.
target_audience: Novice programmers, students, or professionals transitioning into software development with no prior coding experience.
learning_outcomes: Write and execute basic Python scripts using fundamental syntax
Explain core programming concepts such as variables, loops, and conditionals
Design simple algorithms to solve computational problems
Utilize Python data structures including lists, dictionaries, and tuples
Debug and test code using standard Python development tools
Apply functions and modular programming principles to organize code
